li.p: Exciting Announcement from the Avery, Mitchell, Yancey (AMY) Regional Library System! The AMY Regional Library System is now ready to take information over the phone to give individuals virtual access to all digital library resources. If a student would like a virtual library card, their parent or guardian should contact their local library or the regional office to set one up. Virtual access will give students and parents access to hundreds of online, downloadable books! Happy reading!

﻿Avery County Schools will continue to provide a drive-by grab and go lunch operation for all Avery County Students. You may pick up a breakfast and lunch meal at Newland Elementary from 10:30 to 1:30. We encourage all families to participate in this distribution effort. We will also continue to deliver breakfast and lunch, as well as classwork materials, on yellow buses. You can expect delivery at your child's normal bus stop on a 4 hour delay. Please meet the bus at your child's normal bus stop and pick up breakfast and lunch for your children.﻿

div.p: Welcome to the Avery County School System! I am extremely honored and humbled to be entrusted to serve as Superintendent of this great school system. Please feel free to browse through our school district website to get an overview of the many great things going on in Avery County. Our school system is blessed to have great professionals who put the needs of our children first. As you browse our website, you will discover numerous outstanding academic, vocational, fine arts, extra-curricular, and athletic programs.

Avery County Schools have consistently demonstrated tremendous academic growth over the past several years. We pledge to work together in partnership with our talented group of educators and parents to continue our pursuit of excellence. Every child will be challenged daily so they may excel at the highest levels. We will continue to hire the most qualified personnel to fill all roles within our organization.

As Superintendent, I am committed to maintaining a high visibility and engagement in our school system from the classroom to the bus garage. I am enthusiastic about filling the expectations that are established with this position and pursuing the exciting opportunities ahead of us.

The students and staff of Avery County are very fortunate to have a supportive community committed to ensuring all students receive the highest quality education. Strong community partnerships are evident throughout the school system as local faith-based groups, civic organizations, and volunteers are visible in our schools and classrooms on a daily basis. I share in this commitment and will strive to strengthen these relationships and community partnerships to support high achievement of our students.

I look forward to working collaboratively with all stakeholders as we emphasize rigor, relevance, and relationships throughout our system. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have questions, concerns, or ideas about the education of our children. Thank you for your interest and support of the Avery County School System!
